item.title: Upgrading NixOS Channels
item.description: Upgrading NixOS so that it uses a different channel is simple. When you run following command as root: nix-channel --list You should see a list of channels. If you did not touch channels so far, you should see this: nixos https://nixos.org/channels/nixos-21.05 By running the following command (as root): nix-channel --add https://nixos.org/channels/<channel version> nixos you will remove the 21.05 channel and replace it with <channel version>. item.title: Generating Random Strings on Linux in One Line
item.description: With following command you can print a random string of a certain length on Linux. tr -dc A-Za-z0-9 </dev/urandom | head -c 32 ; echo '' The string is safe to use in most web contexts such as HTML forms or environment variables.
